title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create variables with proper TypeScript types:
1. A string variable `username` with your name
2. A number variable `age` with your age
3. A boolean variable `isStudent` set to true
4. An array of numbers called `grades` with at least 3 grade values
5. Calculate and log the average grade

Log all variables to see their values.
instructions:
Create variables with proper TypeScript types:
1. A string variable `username` with your name
2. A number variable `age` with your age
3. A boolean variable `isStudent` set to true
4. An array of numbers called `grades` with at least 3 grade values
5. Calculate and log the average grade

Log all variables to see their values.

hints.text: Add `: string`, `: number`, `: boolean`, and `: number[]` after each variable name.

commonMistakes.mistake: Mixing up type names (String vs string)
commonMistakes.consequence: Uppercase String is a JavaScript wrapper object, not a primitive type.
commonMistakes.correction: Use lowercase: string, number, boolean for primitive types.

commonMistakes.consequence: let nums: number declares a single number, not an array.
commonMistakes.correction: Use brackets for arrays: let nums: number[]
